Each round represents **one year of excavation**. A round consists of the following phases:
| **1. Funding & Resources** | Players may trade resources with the pool or with each other. Each trade costs 1 resource per unit. |

| **2. Digging** | Players may choose up to **two** hexes to dig. For each chosen hex:

â€¢ If the sum â‰¥ 7

the dig fails and the hex is marked â€œFailedâ€.

| **3. Resonance & Preservation** | Players may play **one** artifact card from their hand onto their exhibit track.
â€¢ If the artifactâ€™s resonance type matches another artifact already on the track
column2:
the player gains a **Resonance Bonus** (see table).
â€¢ The player may also play a Preservation token to protect an artifact from looters or earthquakes. |

column1: | **4. Event** | Resolve the current event card. After resolution

column2: apply its effect. Looters may steal artifacts from any playerâ€™s exhibit unless protected. Earthquakes may damage the dig site (flip a hex to â€œDamagedâ€ and lose one resource). |

column1: | **6. End of Year** | Players may discard up to 3 cards from their hand to the discard pile. They may also draw new cards from the artifact deck to refill to 5 cards. |
| **Egyptian** | +2 points per Egyptian artifact | Two Egyptian artifacts on exhibit |
| **Mesoamerican** | +1 point per Mesoamerican artifact | Three Mesoamerican artifacts on exhibit |
| **Indigenous** | +3 points per Indigenous artifact | One Indigenous artifact on exhibit |
| **Ancient Greek** | +1 point per Ancient Greek artifact | Two Ancient Greek artifacts on exhibit |
| **Resonance Chain** | +5 points for every 4 artifacts of the same type | 4 or more of the same resonance type |
*Note: Bonuses are cumulative and are applied at the end of each round.*
| **Conservation** | Protects an artifact from looters for one round. |
| **Storage** | Allows an artifact to be stored offâ€‘site; it can be played later without cost. |
| **Display** | Grants +1 point to the artifact when it is played. |
| **Research** | Allows the player to peek at the top 3 artifact cards. |
Players may play only one Preservation token per round.
At the end of the 10th round (10 years)
column2: the game ends. Each playerâ€™s final score is calculated as follows:

column1: 1. **Artifact Value** â€“ Sum of the point values of all artifacts on the exhibit track.
2. **Resonance Bonuses** â€“ Add any bonuses from the Resonance table.
3. **Preservation Bonuses** â€“ Add +1 for each Display token used.
4. **Penalty** â€“ Subtract 2 points for each artifact that was lost to looters.
5. **Final Score** â€“ Total of the above.
The player with the **highest final score** wins the game. In case of a tie
column2: the player who spent the fewest resources wins.
